title: Have you dealt with the most annoying hotel guests?
text:
CNN Leadership
Have you dealt with the most annoying hotel guests? Updated 1308 GMT (2008 HKT) October 5, 2015 10 photos: America's most annoying hotel guests 1. Inattentive parents – Who wouldn't love these precious angels? Their parents -- who seem to have ceded control to their offspring -- are another story. Inattentive parents are the most annoying hotel guests, according to Expedia's 2015 Hotel Etiquette Study. Hide Caption 1 of 10 10 photos: America's most annoying hotel guests 2. Hallway hellraisers – They've turned the bathtub into a beer cooler, and they're 17 shots in. Confronting hallway hellraisers, the second-most aggravating category of hotel guests, is not without its risks. Hide Caption 2 of 10 10 photos: America's most annoying hotel guests 3. Complainers – The wine in the mini-bar is a couple of degrees too cool, and housekeeping neglected to fold the toilet paper into a crisp point. More than half of survey respondents find complainers irritating. Hide Caption 3 of 10 10 photos: America's most annoying hotel guests 4. In-room revelers – What on earth are they doing in there? And how many people have they got packed into room 207? Maybe it's just two squealing bed jumpers. Whatever the case, in-room revelers try the patience of 52% of survey respondents. Hide Caption 4 of 10 10 photos: America's most annoying hotel guests 5. Bickerers – Why go out of town to do what you could easily do at home? Bickering hotel guests annoy a quarter of survey respondents. Hide Caption 5 of 10 10 photos: America's most annoying hotel guests 6. Poolside partiers – They've turned a utilitarian swimming hole into a pulsing pit of unfortunate dance moves. Poolside partiers try the nerves of 22% of respondents. Hide Caption 6 of 10 10 photos: America's most annoying hotel guests 7. Indiscreet lovemakers – A fifth of respondents find the refrain of indiscreet lovemaking unpleasant. Maybe the rest of the guests are fans of the loudly amorous? Hide Caption 7 of 10 10 photos: America's most annoying hotel guests 8. Hot tub canoodlers – We know they already have a room ... Hot tub canoodlers are a turn-off for 20% of respondents. Hide Caption 8 of 10 10 photos: America's most annoying hotel guests 9. Business bar boozers – Some guests could do without the high-fiving of the business bar boozer. Hide Caption 9 of 10 10 photos: America's most annoying hotel guests 10. Elevator chatterbox – Shhhh, 6% of survey respondents would rather ride up and down to their rooms without the verbal assault of the elevator chatterbox. Hide Caption
